intro: Brachyapium pomelianum, commonly known as the mangosteen, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a small evergreen tree that can grow up to 15 meters tall, with glossy, dark green leaves. The plant produces fragrant, white flowers that are followed by bright red, fleshy fruits. Its fruit contains a segmented, white, edible aril surrounding a central seed. The botanical features of Brachyapium pomelianum make it well adapted to humid, tropical climates and nutrient-rich soils.
